message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses a novel framework for improving the adequacy of Neural Machine Translation (NMT) output. This falls under the category of Natural Language Processing (NLP), which is typically classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The proposed framework involves the use of a reconstructor to ensure that the information in the source side is transformed to the target side as much as possible. This involves the use of deep learning techniques, which are typically classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper may also fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it involves the use of neural networks, and cs.CV (Computer Vision) as NMT can be seen as a form of image-to-text translation.
